document.docAuthor: Pádua, Diego G., Sääksjärvi, Ilari E., Monteiro, Ricardo F. & Oliveira, Marcio L.
document.masterDocTitle: Review of the New World genus Acrotaphus Townes, 1960 (Hymenoptera: Ichneumonidae: Pimplinae), with descriptions of fifteen new species

mods:titleInfo.mods:title: Review of the New World genus Acrotaphus Townes, 1960 (Hymenoptera: Ichneumonidae: Pimplinae), with descriptions of fifteen new species

bibRefCitation.author: Gauld, I. D.
bibRefCitation.refString: Gauld, I. D. (1991) The Ichneumonidae of Costa Rica I. Memoirs of the American Entomological Institute, 47, 1 - 589.

paragraph.treatmentCitationGroup:
Acrotaphus chedelae
Gauld, 1991: 327
. Holotype ♀ [#CRI001
101687
], Costa Rica (MNCR) [examined by digital image].

subSubSection.paragraph:
Diagnosis. This species can be distinguished from all other species of
Acrotaphus
by the combination of the following characters: 1) margin of gena behind eyes flat in dorsal view; 2) margin of gena 0.75–0.95× length of eye in dorsal view; 3) posterior ocelli separated from eyes by 0.4–0.7× its diameter in dorsal view; 4) metasoma entirely orange or orange with tergite V blackish centrally, tergites VI+ black; 5) hind leg usually orange, with apex of femur and tibia and all tarsus blackish; 6) ovipositor robust, 1.4–1.7× as long as hind tibia.

Comments. Additional characters to the original description ( ♀ ) are as follows: body [?] 11.0–19.0 mm; mar- gin of gena behind eyes flat in dorsal view; margin of gena [?] 0.75–0.95× length of eye in dorsal view; tarsal claw with basal lobe quadrangular, with claw apex slightly overtaking the posterior margin of lobe.
Distribution. Argentina *, Brazil , Colombia **, Costa Rica , Panama , Paraguay ** and Trinidad and Tobago ** ( Fig 47 ).

Biological notes. Parasitoid of the
Argiope argentata (Fabricius, 1775)
and
Metazygia
sp. [mentioned as Leucage mariana (Taczanowski, 1881) by Gauld (1991) ] ( Gonzaga & Sobczak, 2011 ).
